radiographic_examinations.findings: Moderate amount of free fluid in the left anterior pararenal space extending down the left paracolic gutter; small amount of perihepatic free fluid; moderate amount of free fluid in the right paracolic gutter extending down to the right lower quadrant; the pancreas has lost its normal texture; pancreatic duct dilated up to 5.3 mm in the neck region and up to 5.6 mm in the area of pancreatic head with irregularity distally; distal pancreatic duct tapering in the ampullary region; presence of two pancreatic cysts measuring 8 mm in tail and 5 mm in neck; CBD 8.5 mm at the porta hepatis tapering to 6.6 mm; mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation; no mass in pancreatic head or CBD stone; incidental findings include fundal focal adenomyomatosis of the gallbladder and a 3.8-cm fluid collection in the right cardiophrenic angle.
